result.execSummary:
The defendant Lance Deondrea Booker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay DNA surcharge and all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments.  To be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release from Extended supervision.
*Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other  sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain fulltime employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.  Vocational/educational training.

No drugs or  contact with drug community.
No contact with children  under 18 without approval from agent.

Sex offender assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.
Cognitive behavior therapy.
Comply with sex offender registry.

Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with recommended treatment.  Random urine screens.
**Conditions apply to each count.

Court ordered defendasnt to provide DNA samle and imposed mandatory surcharges.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Pursuant to 973.048 defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lance Deondrea Booker in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Lance Deondrea Booker in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections not made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 25 YEARS  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 15 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS.  
AS TO COUNT 4:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 25 YEARS  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 15 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS.  
AS TO COUNT 7:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS concurrent with any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  

As to each count: Conditions of extended supervision:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Sex Offender assesment  and comply with recommended treatment.
*Random urine screens.
*No drugs.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain fulltime employment
*Obtain high school diploma or GED
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*Comply with sex offender registry
*No contact with children under 18 without approval from agent

As to each count: Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surchages.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharge and all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release from extended supervision.  
Court ordered restitution set at $0.

Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.  

Court informs defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into to the custody of the MIlwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed,
- Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
- Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
- Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;

AS TO AMENDED COUNTS 2, 4 AND 7:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as AMENDED and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 3, 5, 6 AND 8:
State's motion to dismiss and read-in counts 1, 3, 5, 6, and 8 granted by the court.

Defendant Lance Deondrea Booker in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Lance Deondrea Booker in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT 2:
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of a Child, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.92(2), a Class C Felony;
AS TO COUNT 4:
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of a Child, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.92(2), a Class C Felony;
AS TO COUNT 7:
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of a Child, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.92(2), a Class C Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 28, 2014 at 08:15 am.  Calendar call scheduled for August 20, 2014 at 05:00 pm.

Defendant Lance Deondrea Booker in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Lance Deondrea Booker in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for Miriam Falk for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 10.  Atty Sargent was going to move to withdraw as counsel, however, defendant now wishes to keep him as counsel and would like a plea date.
Case is set for 7-17-2014 at 8:30a, Branch 10 for projected plea.
Branch 38 was to hear this matter for Branch 10, however, court bailiffs are not available.  Case is adjourned to 7-9-2014 at 8:15 in Branch 38.

PRELIMINARY HEARING

Defendant Lance Deondrea Booker in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Lance Deondrea Booker in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Louise Bray-MPD Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Upon oral motion by the State, Court amends COUNTS 1 through 5 to reflect the correction of "#410" in the address.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SHJ, HER MOTHER OR HER SCHOOL OR RESIDENCE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Lance Deondrea Booker in court with attorney Terese M Dick.  Defendant Lance Deondrea Booker in custody.  Brittany C. Grayson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DUGAN, Branch 10.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
